availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas M. Jones (Calloway County, KY, prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, judge. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. Brame Jones in Christian County on September 20, 1848. Father of Thomas R. Jones, Eliza J. Jones, James W. Jones, Mary H. C. Jones, Lily J. Jones, Daniel Jones, Martha A. “Anna” Jones, Katy Jones. Merchant in Calloway County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Presiding county judge in Calloway County in 1860. Employed James Lawrence as a farming apprentice in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 2, p. 442A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 2, p. 6 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, Murray, p. 189.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, Murray, p. 90A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film #000465562, p. 326.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
